milestones.name: Record and review your final speech.  Identify areas for further improvement.  Consider joining a local Toastmasters club or similar group for continued practice and feedback. Plan for future speaking opportunities.

milestones.name: Research Irfan Khan's Method Acting Techniques
milestones.description: 1. **Research Irfan Khan's Method Acting Techniques** - 21 days

milestones.name: Study and Practice Foundational Method Acting Exercises
milestones.description: 2. **Study and Practice Foundational Method Acting Exercises** - 30 days

milestones.name: Dedicate time to practicing fundamental method acting exercises such as sense memory, emotional recall, physicalization, and improvisation.  Utilize resources like acting books, online tutorials, and potentially workshops (if accessible within the timeframe). Focus on building a strong foundation in these techniques.  Regularly record and review your practice sessions for self-assessment.
milestones.description: *   Dedicate time to practicing fundamental method acting exercises such as sense memory, emotional recall, physicalization, and improvisation.  Utilize resources like acting books, online tutorials, and potentially workshops (if accessible within the timeframe). Focus on building a strong foundation in these techniques.  Regularly record and review your practice sessions for self-assessment.

milestones.name: Character Development and Application
milestones.description: 3. **Character Development and Application** - 20 days

milestones.name: Select several diverse characters from Irfan Khan's filmography or from other sources.  Develop in-depth character analyses, creating detailed backstories, motivations, and objectives for each.  Apply the method acting techniques learned in Step 2 to embody these characters, focusing on physicality, voice, and emotional depth.  Practice scenes and monologues as each character.
milestones.description: *   Select several diverse characters from Irfan Khan's filmography or from other sources.  Develop in-depth character analyses, creating detailed backstories, motivations, and objectives for each.  Apply the method acting techniques learned in Step 2 to embody these characters, focusing on physicality, voice, and emotional depth.  Practice scenes and monologues as each character.

milestones.name: Build a Base Running Program (45 days)
milestones.description: 1. **Build a Base Running Program (45 days):**  Begin with a consistent running schedule focusing on building endurance. This involves gradually increasing weekly mileage and incorporating easy runs, interval training, and rest days.  Start with shorter distances and gradually increase the duration and intensity of your runs.  Include cross-training activities like swimming or cycling 1-2 times per week to prevent injury and improve overall fitness.

milestones.name: Increase Mileage and Incorporate Long Runs (45 days)
milestones.description: 2. **Increase Mileage and Incorporate Long Runs (45 days):**  Focus on steadily increasing your long run distance each week.  This is crucial for building endurance and getting your body accustomed to the demands of a marathon.  Include hill training to strengthen leg muscles and improve stamina.  Maintain a consistent weekly mileage plan, adjusting based on how your body feels.  Listen to your body and don't push yourself too hard, especially in the early stages.

milestones.name: Implement Race Strategy and Tapering (12 days)
milestones.description: 3. **Implement Race Strategy and Tapering (12 days):**  Develop your race-day strategy, including pacing, hydration, and nutrition plans.  Begin your tapering process, gradually decreasing your weekly mileage in the weeks leading up to the marathon.  This allows your body to recover and store energy for the race. This phase will also include practice runs with your race-day nutrition and hydration plan.

milestones.name: Race Day Preparation and Recovery (4 days)
milestones.description: 4. **Race Day Preparation and Recovery (4 days):**  The final days before the marathon involve carb-loading, final gear checks, and mental preparation.  After the marathon, focus on gradual recovery, including light exercise, stretching, and proper nutrition to help your body repair itself. Include plenty of rest.

milestones.name: Injury Prevention and Strength Training (2 days)
milestones.description: 5. **Injury Prevention and Strength Training (2 days):** Dedicate these two days to strength training and flexibility exercises, focusing on strengthening core muscles and improving flexibility to prevent injuries during your training.  Consider consulting a physical therapist or athletic trainer for guidance on proper techniques.  These days are spread throughout the entire 108 days.
